title: They Signed Contracts for Their Dream Homes Last Year. Now Their Borrowing Costs Are Ballooning.
sub_head: Many buyers in contract for new homes calculated monthly payments based on near-record-low mortgage rates
body:
People who agreed to buy homes under construction but havenâ€™t yet closed are facing mortgage-interest rates that could be nearly double what they anticipated when they paid their deposits.
New-home buyers are confronting multiple obstacles this year, from surging mortgage rates to home construction that is taking longer than usual due to supply-chain and labor constraints.
